actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources ordered to be reported an original measure.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Original measure reported to Senate by Senator McClure. With written report No. 98-7.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Regular Orders. Calendar No. 26.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

actions.text: Executive Comment Received From Interior.
Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.  Report No: 98-269.
Placed on Union Calendar No: 175.
Placed on Consent Calendar No: 12.
Called up by House on Call of Consent Calendar.
Passed House (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.
Senate agreed to the House amendment. By Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 98-196.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Water and Power Resources

official_title: An original bill to provide for the conveyance of certain Federal lands adjacent to Orchard and Lake Shore Drives, Lake Lowell, Boise project, Idaho.

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended) Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to convey to the adjacent landowners for fair market value specified lands adjacent to Lake Shore Drive, Lake Lowell, Boise Project, Idaho. Reserves to the United States all mineral deposits in such lands.

titles.title: An original bill to provide for the conveyance of certain Federal lands adjacent to Orchard and Lake Shore Drives, Lake Lowell, Boise project, Idaho.
